abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Adjustment Operation
            Project (SOSAC) for Kyrgyz Republic achieved its major
            objectives fully; the Bank performance was rated as highly
            satisfactory, however the borrower performance was only
            satisfactory. Relevance of the project objectives was high,
            adopting policies, regulations, and structural improvements
            to modernized the Pension Fund and reduce its deficits was
            key to help the Government improve its fiscal performance
            and in establishing a system consistent with a market
            economy. In the area of Social Assistance (SA), a study
            performed under SOSAC aimed to assess the extent to which
            the means testing formula for SA benefits was effective in
            reaching its intended beneficiaries, and develop
            recommendations on how to improve benefits reaching the
            poor. Lessons learned a) difficulties of the SOSAC Technical
            Assistance (TA) Program played a part in the decision to
            establish a full TA investment operation to support
            implementation of the Consolidated Structural Adjustment
            Credit; b) performance of the implementing agency was
            satisfactory, however the agency had many other
            responsibilities, and limited capabilities, e.g., for
            procurement and donor coordination, which somewhat reduced
            its effectiveness. The SOSAC was not a politically popular
            project in the Kyrgyz Republic.
